Package org.colomoto.biolqm

Interface StatefulLogicalModel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.colomoto.biolqm.LogicalModel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StatefulLogicalModelImpl
    public interface StatefulLogicalModel
extends org.colomoto.biolqm.LogicalModel
    Extension of a logical model with the possibility to store initial states and oracles
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Rui Henriques, Pedro Monteiro

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      List<byte[]> getInitialStates()
      Gets the set of initial states defining a portion of the state-space
      String getName()
      Returns the model's name (by default the associated filename)
      List<List<byte[]>> getOracles()
      Gets the stored oracles
      void setInitialStates​(List<byte[]> states)
      Changes the set of initial states
      void setOracles​(List<List<byte[]>> o)
      Stores a set of oracles within the model

      • Methods inherited from interface org.colomoto.biolqm.LogicalModel

        clone, clone, fillExtraValues, getBooleanizedMap, getComponent, getComponentIndex, getComponents, getExtraComponents, getExtraLogicalFunctions, getExtraValue, getLayout, getLogicalFunctions, getMDDManager, getTargetValue, getView, hasExtraComponents, hasLayout, isBoolean

    • Method Detail

      • getInitialStates

        List<byte[]> getInitialStates()
        Gets the set of initial states defining a portion of the state-space
        Returns:
        list of initial states

      • getOracles

        List<List<byte[]>> getOracles()
        Gets the stored oracles
        Returns:
        list of oracles where each oracle is defined as a set of state-patterns (null if not available)

      • setOracles

        void setOracles​(List<List<byte[]>> o)
        Stores a set of oracles within the model
        Parameters:
        o - list of oracles, where each oracle is defined as a set of state-patterns

      • setInitialStates

        void setInitialStates​(List<byte[]> states)
        Changes the set of initial states
        Parameters:
        states - list of initial states

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the model's name (by default the associated filename)
        Returns:
        the name of the model
